title: RADS error...
body: received a RADS error saying to check my internet connection and firewall settings, on my wife's and my computers, however i have never had the issue with league before and am pretty sure neither of these are an issue...

replies.body:
Weird. This exact problem occured to me literally just a few hours ago, first time it has ever happened for me.

I adjusted my TCP/IPv4 DNS routing to fix it. I had been routing through Google's DNS address of 8.8.8.8 / 8.8.4.4, and I reset it to automatic, and suddenly the launcher worked fine. The LoL client downloaded a small update of some kind, and then I set my DNS routing back to the Google servers, and it's been fine since.

I don't fully understand the weird voodoo of internet protocol, but it seems safe to assume either Google or my ISP changed something somewhere along the line, causing the blip.
worked right away. thanks for posting this one.

thank you so much. watched 3 youtube vids that were total BS and a complete waste of time.
This worked for me instantly and took 2 seconds to do.

This issue may be due to a change with your OS settings or permissions that's preventing League from launching.  As a first step, I recommend going over the instructions in our [Permissions ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions)guide to rule this out.  Let me know if your issue persists, and I'd be happy to help!
Could you perform the steps on the [Connection Troubleshooting Guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues)?
